intro: Grindelia camporum var. parviflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of ecological and botanical study.
